fleat package

Submodules

fleat.lr_predictor module

lr_predictor.py: Houses the getLR() method

fleat.lr_predictor.getLR(sample_data: ndarray, model: Model, optimizer: str) → float[source]

Runs the pretrained learning rate predictor model for any given dataset, model, and optimizer. Returns a predicted learning rate.

Parameters

  • sample_data (np.ndarray) – The sample images, accepts a Numpy ndarray. Needs to be of shape (a, x, y, c) or (a, x, y), with a being the number of images, x and y being the dimensions, and c being the color channels.

  • model (keras.Model) – A fully built Keras model, does not need to be compiled.

  • optimizer –

    A string representing a valid Keras optimizer. The following are the only valid Keras optimizers:

    • SGD

    • RMSprop

    • Adam

    • Adadelta

    • Adagrad

    • Adamax

    • Nadam

    • Ftrl

Uppercase or lowercase does not matter.

Custom optimizers are not currently supported by Fleat. :type optimizer: str

Returns

A learning rate

Return type

float

Raises

  • ValueError – if the input image’s color channels are not either None, 1, or 3

  • ValueError – if the optimizer is not a valid Keras optimizer

fleat.preprocessor module

preprocessor.py: Houses the preprocess_images() method, which preprocesses any unprocessed input data.

fleat.preprocessor.preprocess_images(x: ndarray) → ndarray[source]

Convert images of shape (a, x, y, c) or (a, x, y) to (100, 224, 224, 1), with a being the number of images, x and y being the dimensions, and c being the color channels. Is automatically called by the getLR() function, but can still be called upon manually.

Parameters

x (np.ndarray) – The input images, accepts a Numpy ndarray

Returns

The modified images of shape (100, 224, 224, 1)

Return type

np.ndarray

Raises

ValueError – if the input image’s color channels are not either None, 1, or 3
